definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: He collects specializing in various rabbit-hole story.
sentences.chinese: 他乐衷于汇集各类光怪陆离的故事。

sentences.english: They splashed the wall with different colours.
sentences.chinese: 他们把墙上涂抹得光怪陆离。

sentences.english: Nothing could be more bizarre and at the same time more motley than this troop.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比这种队伍更奇特和光怪陆离的了。

sentences.english: The tall, pointed windows glow in a thousand colours;
sentences.chinese: 还有，一扇扇尖形长窗，尽是光怪陆离。

sentences.english: This bizarre episode left us civil servants scratching our heads.
sentences.chinese: 光怪陆离的剧情让我们公务员丈二和尚摸不着头脑。
那是一种光怪陆离的杂拌儿。

sentences.english: The bazaar was a kaleidoscope of strange sights and impressions.
sentences.chinese: 那是一种光怪陆离的杂拌儿。

sentences.english: It was imaginative waistcoat with exceedingly fanciful glass buttons.
sentences.chinese: 花哨的坎肩上配搭着一些光怪陆离的玻璃钮扣。

definition: bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
all kinds of/all sorts of/every (different) kind of
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
